<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following methods and assumptions were used to estimate the
    fair value of each class of financial instruments. These
    assumptions were based on subjective estimates of market
    conditions and perceived risks of the financial instruments at a
    certain point in time.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">a.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Cash and Cash
    Equivalents, Accrued Interest Receivable and Interest
    Payable</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For these short-term instruments, the carrying value
    approximates fair value because these instruments are short-term
    in nature and do not present unanticipated credit concerns.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">b.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Securities</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For securities held to maturity or available for sale, fair
    values are based on quoted market prices or dealer quotes. If a
    quoted market price is not available, fair value is estimated
    using quoted market prices for similar instruments.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">c.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Loans Held for
    Sale</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Loans held for sale are carried at fair value. Fair value is
    determined based on quoted market rates or, in the case where a
    firm commitment has been made to sell the loan, the firm
    committed price.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">d.&#160;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Net
    Loans</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of performing loans is calculated by discounting
    scheduled cash flows through the estimated maturity using
    estimated market discount rates that reflect the credit and
    interest rate risk inherent in the loan. The estimate of
    maturity is based on the Company&#146;s and the industry&#146;s
    historical experience with repayments for each loan
    classification, modified, as required, by an estimate of the
    effect of current economic and lending conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Fair value for significant nonaccrual (impaired) loans is based
    on estimated cash flows that are discounted using a rate
    commensurate with the risk associated with the estimated cash
    flows.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    F-41
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Assumptions regarding credit risk, cash flows and discount rates
    are determined using available market information and specific
    borrower information.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">e.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Interest Rate
    Swaps</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of interest swaps executed by the Company is
    determined based on the fair market value as quoted by
    broker-dealers.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">f.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Bank-Owned Life
    Insurance</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of bank-owned life insurance is equal to its cash
    surrender value.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">g.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Deposit
    Liabilities</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The fair value of deposits with no stated maturity, such as
    non-interest-bearing deposits, interest-bearing deposits,
    savings and money market deposit accounts, is equal to the
    amount payable on demand as of year-end. The fair value of
    certificates of deposit and brokered deposits are based on the
    discounted value of contractual cash flows. The discount rate is
    estimated using the rates currently offered for deposits of
    similar remaining maturities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">h.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Funds
    Borrowed</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Rates currently available to the Company and the banks for debt
    with similar terms and remaining maturities are used to estimate
    fair value of existing debt.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">i.&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">Off-Balance Sheet
    Financial Instruments</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company&#146;s commitments to originate loans and unused
    lines and outstanding letters of credit are primarily at
    market-based interest rates, and therefore there is no fair
    value adjustment.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;15&#151;REGULATORY
    REQUIREMENTS</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The banks are subject to federal and state laws, which restrict
    the payment of dividends to the Company. Based on these
    restrictions, at January&#160;1, 2007, The
    PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago could have declared $100,474,015
    in dividends without requesting approval of the applicable
    federal or state regulatory agency. As of January&#160;1, 2007,
    The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; St.&#160;Louis could have declared
    $9,771,248 in dividends without requesting approval of the
    applicable federal or state regulatory agency. As of
    January&#160;1, 2007, The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Michigan could
    have declared $7,950,117 in dividends without requesting
    approval of the applicable federal or state regulatory agency.
    The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Georgia could have declared $148,295
    in dividends without requesting approval of the applicable
    federal or state regulatory agency as of January&#160;1, 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The PrivateBank&#160;&#150; Chicago is required to maintain
    non-interest-bearing cash balances with the Federal Reserve
    based on the types and amounts of deposits held. During 2006 and
    2005, the average balances maintained to meet the requirement
    were $25,000.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company and the banks are subject to various regulatory
    capital requirements as established by the applicable federal or
    state banking regulatory authorities. Under capital adequacy
    guidelines and the regulatory framework for prompt corrective
    action, the Company and the banks must meet specific capital
    guidelines that involve quantitative measures of the banks&#146;
    assets, liabilities and certain off-balance sheet items. The
    quantitative measures for capital adequacy require the Company
    and the banks to maintain minimum amounts and ratios of total
    and Tier&#160;1 capital to risk weighted assets and of
    Tier&#160;1 capital to average assets (leverage). The
    Company&#146;s and the banks&#146; capital components,
    classification, risk weightings and other factors are also
    subject to qualitative judgments by regulators. Failure to meet
    minimum capital requirements can initiate certain actions by
    regulators that, if undertaken, could have a material effect on
    the Company&#146;s financial statements. Prompt corrective
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-42
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    action provisions are not applicable to bank holding companies.
    Management believes that as of December&#160;31, 2006, the
    Company and the banks meet all minimum capital adequacy
    requirements to which they are subject. To be categorized as
    well capitalized, an institution must maintain ratios as set
    forth in the following table. Management believes that no events
    or changes in conditions have occurred subsequent to such
    notification to change the bank&#146;s category.
</DIV>

    <BR>
    F-43

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;16&#151;CONTINGENT
    LIABILITIES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Because of the nature of its activities, the Company is from
    time to time involved in legal actions that arise in the normal
    course of business. In the judgment of management, after
    consultation with legal counsel, none of the litigation to which
    the Company or its subsidiaries is a defendant is expected to
    have a material effect, either individually or in the aggregate,
    on the consolidated balance sheet, results of operations or cash
    flows of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;17&#151;PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. (PARENT COMPANY ONLY) CONDENSED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">PRIVATEBANCORP,
    INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <B>NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
    STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>
<P>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;18&#151;CAPITAL
    TRANSACTIONS</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During 2006 and 2005, the Company repurchased 66,997 and
    12,928&#160;shares, respectively, of its common stock in
    connection with the satisfaction of stock option exercises and
    minimum federal withholding tax requirements on the exercise of
    stock options and vesting of restricted stock and shares
    repurchased in the open market.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">NOTE&#160;19&#151;ADOPTION
    OF SEC STAFF ACCOUNTING BULLETIN NO.&#160;108
    (&#147;SAB&#160;108&#148;)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Company adopted SAB&#160;108 in the fourth quarter of 2006.
    In accordance with SAB&#160;108, the Company decreased its
    January&#160;1, 2006 retained earnings by $2.5&#160;million,
    which decreased stockholders&#146; equity to $236.1&#160;million
    from $238.6&#160;million at that date. This $2.5&#160;million
    adjustment was the result of computational errors in the tax
    provision from 1996 to 2005. Deferred tax assets decreased
    approximately $1.9&#160;million due to errors in the
    Company&#146;s modified retrospective adoption of
    SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123(R). Current taxes payable increased
    $637,000 due to computational errors that arose prior to the
    adoption of SFAS&#160;No.&#160;123(R). These errors caused an
    immaterial understatement of tax expense in each of the years
    from 1996 to 2005, but the cumulative effect of these errors was
    material to 2006. In evaluating materiality and determining the
    appropriateness of applying SAB&#160;108 to these errors, the
    Company considered materiality both qualitatively and
    quantitatively as proscribed by the SEC&#146;s Staff Accounting
    Bulletin&#160;No.&#160;99 (&#147;SAB&#160;99&#148;). Evaluation
    of materiality requires the Company to consider all the relevant
    circumstances including qualitative factors which may cause
    misstatements of quantitatively small amounts to be material.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    F-47
</DIV><!-- END LOGICAL PAGE -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<TD align="left" valign="bottom">
<DIV style="text-indent: -7pt; margin-left: 7pt">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused
    this report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly
    authorized.

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 88%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN LOGICAL PAGE -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica">POWER OF
    ATTORNEY</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    KNOW ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that each person whose
    signature appears below hereby constitutes and appoints Ralph B.
    Mandell and Dennis L. Klaeser, and each of them, the true and
    lawful
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">attorney-in-fact</FONT>
    and agents of the undersigned, with full power of substitution
    and resubstitution, for and in the name, place and stead of the
    undersigned, to sign any and all amendments to this Annual
    Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K,</FONT>
    and to file the same, with all exhibits thereto and other
    documents in connection therewith, with the Securities and
    Exchange Commission, and hereby grants to such
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">attorneys-in-fact</FONT>
    and agents, and each of them, full power and authority to do and
    perform each and every act and thing requisite and necessary to
    be done, as fully as to all intents and purposes as each of the
    undersigned might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and
    confirming all that said
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">attorneys-in-fact</FONT>
    and agents, or any of them, or their or his substitutes, may
    lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">No.&#160;000-25887)</FONT>
    and incorporated herein by reference).*
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Exhibit&nbsp;A &#151; Form of Amended and Restated Revolving Note

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Exhibit&nbsp;B &#151; Form of Amended and Restated Subordinated Debenture

</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Exhibit&nbsp;D &#151; Form of First Amendment to Collateral Safekeeping Agreement

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Exhibit&nbsp;E &#151; Form of Legal Opinion

</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>FIRST AMENDMENT TO LOAN AND SUBORDINATED DEBENTURE PURCHASE AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This FIRST AMENDMENT TO LOAN AND SUBORDINATED DEBENTURE PURCHASE AGREEMENT <B>(&#147;First
Amendment&#148;</B>), dated as of December&nbsp;12, 2006, is entered into by and between PRIVATEBANCORP, INC., a
Delaware corporation (<B>&#147;Borrower&#148;)</B>, and LASALLE BANK NATIONAL ASSOCIATION, a national banking
association (<B>&#147;Lender&#148;</B>).
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B><U>R</U>
<U>E</U> <U>C</U> <U>I</U> <U>T</U> <U>A</U> <U>L</U> <U>S</U> :</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;The parties hereto have entered into that certain Loan and Subordinated Debenture
Purchase Agreement, dated as of September&nbsp;29, 2005, as previously amended, restated,
supplemented or
modified from time to time (the <B>&#147;2005 Loan Agreement&#148;</B>).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;The parties hereto desire to amend and modify the 2005 Loan Agreement in accordance
with the terms and subject to the conditions set forth in this First Amendment. As amended and
modified by
this First Amendment, the 2005 Loan Agreement may be referred to as
the <B>&#147;Agreement.&#148;</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C.&nbsp;The parties desire to amend the terms of the 2005 Loan Agreement to (i)&nbsp;extend the
Revolving Loan Maturity Date, (ii)&nbsp;increase the Revolving Loan Amount, (iii)&nbsp;extend the Term
Loan Maturity
Date, (iv)&nbsp;extend the Subordinated Debt Maturity Date, (v)&nbsp;increase and extend the
Subordinated Debt
Amount, (vi)&nbsp;extend the Sub Debt Funding Expiration Date, and (vii)&nbsp;reflect the pending merger
of Borrower
with Piedmont Bancshares, Inc. and the resulting acquisition by Borrower of the outstanding
capital stock of
Piedmont Bank of Georgia. The parties agree to undertake such modifications, and the other
modifications
described in this First Amendment, in accordance with the terms, subject to the conditions,
and in reliance
upon the recitals, representations, warranties and covenants set forth herein, in the
Agreement, and in the
other Loan Documents, irrespective of whether entered into or delivered on or after September
29, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;Capitalized terms used but not otherwise defined in this First Amendment shall have the
meanings respectively ascribed to them in the 2005 Loan Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual representations, warranties, covenants, and
agreements hereinafter set forth, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and
sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B><U>A</U>
<U>G</U> <U>R</U> <U>E</U> <U>E</U> <U>M</U> <U>E</U> <U>N</U>
<U>T</U> :</B></FONT>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>A.&nbsp;</B><U><B>Amendment
to Recital &#147;A&#148; of the 2005 Loan Agreement</B></U>. Recital &#147;A&#148; to the
2005 Loan Agreement is hereby deleted and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;A. Borrower is a bank holding company that owns 100% of the issued and
outstanding capital stock of The PrivateBank and Trust Company, an Illinois
state-chartered, non-member bank with its main office located in Chicago,
Illinois (<B>&#147;PrivateBank&#148;</B>), The PrivateBank, a federal savings bank with its
main office located in St. Louis, Missouri (<B>&#147;PrivateBank St.
Louis&#148;</B>), and
The PrivateBank, a Michigan state-chartered, non-member bank with its main
office located in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan (<B>&#147;PrivateBank Michigan"</B>).
Subject to the last sentence of this recital, the banks identified in the
immediately preceding sentence may be referred to herein collectively as the
<B>&#147;Subsidiary Banks&#148;</B>and individually as a <B>&#147;Subsidiary Bank.&#148; </B>Subject to the
last sentence of this recital, the issued and outstanding capital stock of
PrivateBank, PrivateBank St. Louis and PrivateBank Michigan may be referred
to as the <B>&#147;Pledged Subsidiary Bank Shares&#148; </B>Borrower is a party to that
certain Agreement and Plan of Merger, dated as of August&nbsp;2, 2006, with
Piedmont Bancshares, Inc. (as amended, restated, modified or supplemented
from time to time, the <B>&#147;Piedmont Merger</B>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>Agreement&#148;</B>). Upon consummation of the transactions described in the Piedmont
Merger Agreement (the <B>&#147;Piedmont Merger&#148;</B>), Piedmont Bank of Georgia, a
Georgia state-chartered, non-member bank with its main office located in
Atlanta, Georgia (<B>&#147;Piedmont Bank&#148;</B>), wilt be a wholly-owned subsidiary of
Borrower. Effective upon consummation of the Piedmont Merger, Piedmont Bank
shall be included in the definition <B>&#147;Subsidiary Banks&#148; </B>for all purposes
hereunder, and its issued and outstanding capital stock shall be included in
the definition of <B>&#147;Pledged Subsidiary Bank Shares&#148; </B>for all purposes
hereunder.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>B.&nbsp;</B><U><B>Amendment
to Recital &#147;C of the 2005 Loan Agreement</B></U>. Recital &#147;C&#148; to the 2005 Loan
Agreement is hereby deleted and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;C. Borrower has requested that Lender provide it with three credit
facilities in the aggregate principal amount of $115,000,000 consisting of
(a)&nbsp;a term loan (the <B>&#147;Term Loan&#148;</B>) in the principal amount of $250,000 (the
<B>&#147;Term Loan Amount&#148;</B>), (b)&nbsp;a revolving line-of-credit (the <B>&#147;Revolving Loan&#148;</B>)
in the principal amount of up to $64,750,000 (the <B>&#147;Revolving Loan Amount&#148;</B>),
and (c)&nbsp;subordinated debt (the <B>&#147;Subordinated Debt&#148;</B>) in the principal amount
of up to $50,000,000. The Term Loan and the Revolving Loan may be referred
to collectively as the <B>&#147;Senior Loans&#148;</B> and the Senior Loans and the
Subordinated Debt may be referred to collectively as the &#147;Loans.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>C.&nbsp;</B><U><B>Amendments
to Section&nbsp;1.1 of the 2005 Loan Agreement</B></U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) The term &#147;Indentures&#148; is hereby deleted from <U>Section&nbsp;1.1</U> of the
2005 Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Indenture(s)&#148; </B>means, either collectively or individually, as
applicable (a)&nbsp;that certain indenture dated as of December&nbsp;5, 2005, between
Borrower and Wilmington Trust Company, as indenture trustee, (b)&nbsp;that
certain indenture dated June&nbsp;20, 2005, between Borrower and Wilmington Trust
Company, and (c)&nbsp;that certain indenture dated May&nbsp;12, 2004 between Borrower,
as successor to BHB, and Wilmington Trust Company, as trustee.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) The term &#147;Junior Subordinated Debentures&#148; is hereby deleted from
<U>Section&nbsp;1.1</U> of the 2005 Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the
following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Junior Subordinated Debentures&#148;</B> means, either collectively or
individually, as applicable (a)&nbsp;the fixed/floating rate junior subordinated
debentures, dated December&nbsp;5, 2005 and due 2035, issued by Borrower, (b)&nbsp;the
fixed/floating rate junior subordinated debentures, dated June&nbsp;20, 2005 and
due 2035, issued by Borrower, and (c)&nbsp;the floating rate junior subordinated
debentures due 2034 issued by BHB, in each case pursuant to the applicable
Indenture.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) The term &#147;Revolving Loan Maturity Date&#148; is hereby deleted from <U>Section
1.1</U> of the 2005 Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%"><B>&#147;Revolving Loan Maturity Date&#148; </B>means December&nbsp;31, 2007.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) The term &#147;Sub Debt Funding Expiration Date&#148; is hereby deleted from
<U>Section&nbsp;1.1</U> of the 2005 Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the
following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Sub Debt Funding Expiration Date&#148; </B>means December&nbsp;31, 2007.&#148;
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>



<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) The term &#147;Subordinated Debt Amount&#148; is hereby deleted from <U>Section
1.1</U> of the 2005 Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Subordinated Debt Amount&#148; </B>means $50,000,000.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) The term &#147;Subordinated Debt Maturity Date&#148; is hereby deleted from
<U>Section&nbsp;1.1</U> of the 2005 Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the
following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Subordinated Debt Maturity Date&#148; </B>means December&nbsp;31, 2017.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)
The term &#147;Term Loan Maturity Date&#148; is hereby deleted from <U>Section&nbsp;1.1</U>
of the 2005 Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Term Loan Maturity Date&#148;</B> means December&nbsp;31, 2017.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii) The term &#147;Trust(s)&#148; is hereby deleted from <U>Section&nbsp;1.1</U> of the 2005
Loan Agreement and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Trust(s)&#148; </B>means, collectively or individually, as applicable (a)&nbsp;that
certain Delaware statutory business trust known as &#147;PrivateBancorp Stautory
Trust III,&#148; which is maintained by Borrower in accordance with that certain
Amended and Restated Trust Agreement dated as of December&nbsp;5, 2005, (b)&nbsp;that
certain Delaware statutory business trust known as &#147;PrivateBancorp Statutory
Trust II,&#148; which is maintained by Borrower in accordance with that certain
Amended and Restated Declaration of Trust dated June&nbsp;20, 2005, and (c)&nbsp;that
certain Delaware statutory business trust known as &#147;Bloomfield Hills
Statutory Trust I,&#148; which is maintained by Borrower, as successor to BHB, in
accordance with that certain Amended and Restated Declaration of Trust dated
May&nbsp;12, 2004.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(viii) Each of the following provisions is hereby added to Section&nbsp;1.1, and deemed
placed in the appropriate alphabetical order:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Piedmont Bank&#148; </B>has the meaning ascribed to such term in the recitals
hereto.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Piedmont Merger&#148; </B>has the meaning ascribed to such term in the
recitals hereto.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>&#147;Piedmont Merger Agreement&#148; </B>has the meaning ascribed to such term in the recitals
hereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>D.&nbsp;</B><U><B>Amendment
to Section&nbsp;4.3.1 of the 2005 Loan Agreement</B></U>.
<U>Section&nbsp;4.3.1</U> of the 2005
Loan Agreement is hereby deleted and replaced in its entirety with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&#147;<B>4.3.1</B> The proceeds of the Loans shall be used by the Borrower to fund the
cash consideration to be paid by Borrower in connection with the
consummation of the Piedmont Merger, for working capital and for general
corporate purposes.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>E.&nbsp;</B><U><B>Representations
and Warranties</B></U>. The Borrower hereby represents and warrants to the
Lender as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) No Event of Default or Potential Event of Default has occurred and is
continuing (or would result from the amendments contemplated hereby).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) The execution, delivery and performance by the Borrower of this First
Amendment have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate and other action and do not
and will not
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">require any registration with, consent or approval of, or notice to or action by any Person
(including any Governmental Agency) in order to be effective and enforceable.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) This First Amendment and the other Loan Documents (as amended by this First
Amendment) constitute the legal, valid and binding obligations of the Borrower, enforceable
against the Borrower in accordance with their respective terms.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) All representations and warranties of the Borrower in the 2005 Loan Agreement (as
modified by this First Amendment) are true and correct, except, for the purposes of this
First Amendment only, all references in <U>Section&nbsp;4.4</U> of the 2005 Loan Agreement to
(x)&nbsp;the term &#147;Financial Statements&#148; shall be deemed to refer to &#147;the consolidated financial
statements as of and for the year ending December, 31, 2005, and as of and for the nine
months ending September&nbsp;30, 2006, audited in the case of Borrower&#146;s year end financial
statements by the Borrower&#146;s certified public accountants.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) The Borrower&#146;s obligations under the Agreement and under the other Loan Documents
are not subject to any defense, counterclaim, set-off, right to recoupment, abatement or
other claim.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi) The Piedmont Merger Agreement remains in full force and effect and is identical
to the agreement included as Annex A to the proxy statement/prospectus included as part of
the Form S-4 filed by Borrower with the SEC. Borrower has not breached, and to the best of
Borrower&#146;s knowledge Piedmont has not breached, its obligations under the Piedmont Merger
Agreement. All approvals and consents from Governmental Agencies required to be obtained in
order for the transactions that are contemplated by the Piedmont Merger Agreement to be
consummated have been obtained. The Piedmont Merger is scheduled to be consummated on or
before December&nbsp;31, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>F.&nbsp;</B><U><B>Conditions</B></U><B>.</B> Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained elsewhere in the
Agreement, the obligation of the Lender to extend the Revolving Loan Maturity Date, Term Loan
Maturity Date and Subordinated Debt Maturity Date; increase the Revolving Loan Amount and
Subordinated Debt Amount, and agree to the other modifications contemplated by this First
Amendment, shall be subject to the performance by the Borrower prior to the date on which this
First Amendment is executed (the &#147;Amendment Closing Date&#148;) of all of its agreements theretofore to
be performed under the Agreement and to the satisfaction of the following conditions precedent.
The obligations to continue to make disbursements of proceeds under the Loans are, and shall
remain, subject to the conditions precedent in the 2005 Loan Agreement and to the receipt by the
Lender of all the following in form and substance satisfactory to the Lender and its counsel, and,
where appropriate, duly executed and dated the Amendment Closing Date:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) an amended and restated Revolving Note, substantially in the form of <U>Exhibit&nbsp;A
</U>attached hereto;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) an amended and restated Subordinated Debenture, substantially in the form of
<U>Exhibit&nbsp;B</U> attached hereto;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) an amendment to the Pledge Agreement, substantially in the form of <U>Exhibit&nbsp;C</U> attached hereto;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) an amendment to the Collateral Safekeeping Agreement, substantially in the form
of <U>Exhibit&nbsp;D</U> attached hereto;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v) a certificate of good standing of the Borrower, certified by the appropriate
governmental official in its jurisdiction of incorporation and dated within the five
business days preceding the date hereof;
</DIV>

</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi) (a)&nbsp;copies, certified by the Secretary or Assistant Secretary of the
Borrower, of the (I)&nbsp;resolutions duly adopted by the board of directors of the Borrower (or
the appropriate committee thereof) authorizing the execution, delivery and performance of
this First Amendment and the other documents to be delivered by the Borrower pursuant to
this First Amendment (including the First Amendment, the &#147;Amendment-Related Documents&#148;),
and (II)&nbsp;the Bylaws of the Borrower as currently in effect; and (b)&nbsp;a certification by the
Secretary or Assistant Secretary of the Borrower that there has been no amendment to the
articles of incorporation of the Borrower from and after September&nbsp;29, 2005, and that the
articles of incorporation delivered by the Borrower to the Lender on September&nbsp;29, 2005,
remain in full force and effect; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii) a written opinion of Vedder, Price, Kaufman &#038; Kammholz, P.C., counsel to the
Borrower, addressed to the Lender, substantially in the form of <U>Exhibit&nbsp;E</U> attached
hereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>G.&nbsp;</B><U><B>Additional
Terms</B></U><B>.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)
<U>Acknowledgment of Indebtedness under Agreement</U>. The Borrower acknowledges and
confirms that, as of the date hereof, the Borrower is indebted to the Lender, without defense,
setoff, or counterclaim, in the aggregate principal amount of (i)&nbsp;Two Hundred Fifty Thousand and
No/100 Dollars ($250,000) under the Term Loan, (ii)&nbsp;Nineteen Million and 00/100 Dollars
($19,000,000) under the Revolving Loan and (iii)&nbsp;Twenty-One Million and No/100 Dollars
($21,000,000) under the Subordinated Debt.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)
<U>The Agreement</U>. All references in the 2005 Loan Agreement to the term &#147;Agreement&#148;
shall be deemed to refer to the Agreement referenced in this First Amendment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)
<U>First Amendment and 2005 Loan Agreement to be Read Together</U>. This First
Amendment supplements and is hereby made a part of the 2005 Loan Agreement, and the 2005 Loan
Agreement and this First Amendment shall from and after the date hereof be read together and
shall
constitute the Agreement. Except as otherwise set forth herein, the 2005 Loan Agreement shall
remain in full
force and effect. :
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)
<U>Loan Documents</U>. The term &#147;Loan Documents,&#148; as used in the Agreement, shall from
and after the date hereof include the Amendment-Related Documents.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)
<U>Counterparts</U>. This First Amendment may be executed by facsimile and in one or
more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which taken together shall
constitute one and the same document.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)
<U>Acknowledgments</U>. The Borrower acknowledges that (i)&nbsp;it has been advised by
counsel of its choice with respect to this First Amendment, the Loan Documents and the
transactions contemplated thereby, (ii)&nbsp;each of the waivers set forth herein was knowingly and
voluntarily made, and (iii)&nbsp;the obligations of the Lender hereunder shall be strictly construed
and shall be expressly subject to the Borrower&#146;s compliance in all respects with the terms and
conditions of the Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)
<U>Delivery of Outstanding Capital Stock of Piedmont Bank: Change of Name</U>. No later
than one Business Day following the consummation of the Piedmont Merger, Borrower shall deliver to
the Custodian (as defined in the Collateral Safekeeping Agreement) stock certificates issued by
Piedmont Bank to Borrower and evidencing all of the outstanding capital stock of Piedmont Bank,
together with irrevocable stock powers for each such certificate endorsed by Borrower in blank.
Lender acknowledges and agrees that as of (or shortly after) the consummation of the Piedmont
Merger, Piedmont Bank will change its name to &#147;The Private Bank.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(viii)
<U>No Novation</U>. The terms and conditions of the 2005 Loan Agreement and the Notes
issued in favor of the Lender thereunder (the &#147;Original Notes&#148;) are amended as set forth in, and
superceded and, with respect to the Revolving Note, and Subordinated Debenture, restated in their
entirety by, the Agreement as modified by this First Amendment and the Revolving Note and
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->5<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Subordinated Debenture issued hereunder in favor of the Lender. It is expressly understood and
acknowledged that nothing in this First Amendment shall be deemed to cause or otherwise give rise
to a novation of the Original Notes. Notwithstanding any provision of this First Amendment, any
Amendment-Related Document or any Loan Document to the contrary, the execution and delivery of the
restated Revolving Note and Subordinated Debenture pursuant to this First Amendment in favor of the
Lender shall be in substitution for, but not in payment of, the Revolving Note and Subordinated
Debenture that constitute a part of the Original Notes, respectively.
All &#147;Borrower&#146;s Liabilities&#148; under the 2005 Loan Agreement shall in all respects be continuing and this First Amendment shall
not be deemed to evidence or result in a novation or repayment and re-borrowing of such &#147;Borrower&#146;s
Liabilities.&#148;
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>EXHIBIT A</B><BR>
<BR>
<B>FORM OF AMENDED AND RESTATED REVOLVING NOTE</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">AMENDED AND RESTATED REVOLVING NOTE
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="10%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="70%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">$64,750,000.00
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">Chicago, Illinois</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">&nbsp;
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">Restatement Date: December <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> , 2006</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">&nbsp;
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">Original Note Date: February 11 , 2000 (as amended)</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>FOR VALUE RECEIVED</B>, the undersigned, PRIVATEBANCORP, INC., a Delaware corporation
(<B>&#147;Borrower&#148;</B>), promises to pay to the order of LASALLE BANK NATIONAL ASSOCIATION, a national
banking association, or the holder hereof from time to time
(<B>&#147;Lender&#148;</B>), at such place as may be
designated in writing by Lender, the principal sum of SIXTY-FOUR MILLION SEVEN HUNDRED FIFTY
THOUSAND AND NO/100THS DOLLARS ($64,750,000.00) (or so much thereof that has been advanced and
remains outstanding), with interest thereon as hereinafter provided. It is contemplated that there
will be advances and payments under this note (this
<B>&#147;Note&#148;</B>) from time to time, but no advances or
payments under this Note (including payment in full of the unpaid balance of principal hereof
prior to maturity) shall affect or impair the validity or enforceability of this Note as to future
advances hereunder. This Note is issued pursuant to the terms of an Amended and Restated Loan and
Subordinated Debenture Purchase Agreement of even date herewith by and between Borrower and Lender
(said Amended and Restated Loan and Subordinated Debenture Purchase Agreement together with the
Agreed Upon Terms and Procedures, as each may be amended, restated, supplemented or modified from
time to time, is referred to hereinafter as the <B>&#147;Loan Agreement&#148;</B>). All capitalized terms used but
not defined herein shall have the respective meanings ascribed to them in the Loan Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Note represents a continuation of the indebtedness represented by that certain Revolving
Note dated February&nbsp;11, 2000 made by Borrower to Lender in the original principal amount of
$18,000,000, as such note has been amended prior to the date hereof (the &#147;Original Revolving
Note&#148;). The Original Revolving Note is amended, restated and replaced by this Note. This Note does
not constitute a novation, discharge or satisfaction of the Original Revolving Note replaced
hereby or of the indebtedness evidenced by said Original Revolving Note.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest shall accrue on all sums as advanced and outstanding from time to time under this
Note and Loan Agreement as set forth in the Loan Agreement. Such interest shall be due and
payable, in arrears (i)&nbsp;for any LIBO Rate Tranche, on the last day of each LIBOR Period, and (ii)
for any Base Rate Tranche, on the last day of each September, December, March and June, beginning
September&nbsp;30, 2005, and as otherwise set forth in the Loan Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The outstanding principal balance of this Note, together with all accrued and unpaid
interest, shall be due and payable on the Revolving Loan Maturity
Date. Additional principal
payments shall be made in accordance with the provisions of the Loan Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Note is issued pursuant to the terms of the Loan Agreement and is secured by and entitled
to the benefits of, among other things, the Collateral Documents. In case an Event of Default shall
occur and be continuing, the principal of this Note together with all accrued interest thereon may,
at the option of the holder hereof, immediately become due and payable on demand; provided,
however, that if any document related to this Note provides for automatic acceleration of payment
of sums owing hereunder, all sums owing hereunder shall be automatically due and payable in
accordance with the terms of that, document.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->A-1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless otherwise provided in the Loan Agreement, all payments on account of the indebtedness
evidenced by this Note shall be first applied to the payment of costs and expenses of Lender which
are due and payable, then to past-due interest on the unpaid principal balance and the remainder
to principal.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provided that no Event of Default then exists, this Note may be prepaid only upon those terms
and conditions set forth in the Loan Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any interest payment required hereunder is not received by Lender on or before the tenth
day following the date it becomes due, Borrower shall pay, at Lender&#146;s option, a late or
collection charge equal to 4% of the amount of such unpaid interest payment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;From and after the Revolving Loan Maturity Date, or such earlier date as all sums owing on
this Note become due and payable by acceleration or otherwise, or after the occurrence of an Event
of Default, interest shall be computed on all amounts then due and payable under this Note at a
<B>&#147;Default Rate&#148;</B> equal to 2% per annum (based on a 360-day year and charged on the basis of actual
days elapsed) in excess of the interest rate otherwise accruing under this Note.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any attorney is engaged by Lender to enforce or defend any provision of this Note or any
of the other Loan Documents, or as a consequence of any Event of Default, with or without the
filing of any legal action or proceeding, then Borrower shall pay to Lender immediately upon
demand all attorneys&#146; fees and expenses, together with interest thereon from the date of such
demand until paid at the rate of interest applicable to the principal balance owing hereunder as
if such unpaid attorneys&#146; fees and expenses had been added to the principal.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No previous waiver and no failure or delay by Lender in acting with respect to the terms of
this Note or any of the other Loan Documents shall constitute a waiver of any breach, default or
failure of condition under this Note, the Loan Agreement or any of the other Loan Documents or the
obligations secured thereby. A waiver of any term of this Note or any of the other Loan Documents
or of any of the obligations secured thereby must be made in writing and shall be limited to the
express written terms of such waiver. In the event of any inconsistencies between the terms of this
Note and the terms of any other document related to the Loan evidenced by this Note, the terms of
this Note shall prevail.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the Loan Agreement, Borrower expressly waives presentment,
demand, notice of dishonor, notice of default or delinquency, notice of acceleration, notice of
protest and nonpayment, notice of costs, expenses or losses and interest thereon, notice of late
charges, and diligence in taking any action to collect any sums owing under this Note or in
proceeding against any of the rights or interests in or to properties securing payment of this
Note. In addition, Borrower expressly agrees that this Note and any payment coming due hereunder
may be extended from time to time without in any way affecting the liability of any such party
hereunder.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Time is of the essence with respect to every provision hereof. This Note shall be construed
and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, except to the extent that
federal laws preempt the laws of the State of Illinois, and all persons and entities in any manner
obligated under this Note consent to the jurisdiction of any Federal or State court within the
State of Illinois having proper venue and also consent to service of process by any means
authorized by Illinois or Federal law. Any reference contained herein to attorneys&#146; fees and
expenses shall be deemed to be to reasonable fees and expenses and to include all reasonable fees
and expenses of in-house or staff attorneys and the reasonable fees and expenses of any other
experts or consultants.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All agreements between Borrower and Lender (including, without limitation, this Note and the
Loan Agreement, and any other documents securing all or any part of the indebtedness evidenced
hereby) are expressly limited so that in no event whatsoever shall the amount paid or agreed to be
paid to Lender exceed the highest lawful rate of interest permissible under applicable law. If,
from any circumstances whatsoever, fulfillment of any provision hereof, the Loan Agreement or any
other documents securing all or any part of the indebtedness evidenced hereby at the time
performance of such provisions shall be due, shall involve exceeding the limit of validity
prescribed by law which a court
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->A-2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">of
competent jurisdiction may deem applicable hereto, then, <I>ipso
facto</I>, the obligation to be
fulfilled shall be reduced to the highest lawful rate of interest permissible under such applicable
laws, and if, for any reason whatsoever, Lender shall ever receive as interest an amount which
would be deemed unlawful under such applicable law, such interest shall be automatically applied to
the payment of the principal of this Note (whether or not then due and payable) and not to the
payment of interest or refunded to Borrower if such principal has been paid in full.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any notice which either party hereto may be required or may desire to give hereunder shall be
governed by the notice provisions of the Loan Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">BORROWER HEREBY KNOWINGLY, VOLUNTARILY AND INTENTIONALLY WAIVES ANY RIGHT THAT IT MAY HAVE TO A
TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LITIGATION ARISING IN ANY WAY IN CONNECTION WITH THIS NOTE OR ANY OF THE
OTHER LOAN DOCUMENTS, OR ANY OTHER STATEMENTS OR ACTIONS OF BORROWER OR LENDER. BORROWER
ACKNOWLEDGES THAT IT HAS BEEN REPRESENTED IN THE SIGNING OF THIS NOTE AND IN THE MAKING OF THIS
WAIVER BY INDEPENDENT LEGAL COUNSEL SELECTED OF ITS OWN FREE WILL, AND THAT IT HAS DISCUSSED THIS
WAIVER WITH SUCH LEGAL COUNSEL. BORROWER FURTHER ACKNOWLEDGES THAT (i)&nbsp;IT HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS
THE MEANING AND RAMIFICATIONS OF THIS WAIVER, (ii)&nbsp;THIS WAIVER HAS BEEN REVIEWED BY BORROWER AND
BORROWER&#146;S COUNSEL AND IS A MATERIAL INDUCEMENT FOR LENDER TO ENTER INTO THE LOAN DOCUMENTS, AND
(iii)&nbsp;THIS WAIVER SHALL BE EFFECTIVE AS TO EACH OF THE LOAN DOCUMENTS AS IF FULLY INCORPORATED
THEREIN.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, </B>the undersigned has executed this Note or caused this Note to be executed
by its duly authorized representative as of the date first above written.
